meanings.definition: Relating to a tabernacle or small temporary dwelling.
meanings.sent1: The tabernacular tent was set up for the camping trip.
meanings.sent2: The tabernacular structure was built for the event.
meanings.sent3: The tabernacular shelter kept us dry during the storm.
meanings.sent4: Her tabernacular house on wheels traveled across the country.
meanings.sent5: The tabernacular cabin nestled in the woods looked cozy and inviting.

meanings.definition: Of or relating to a place of worship.
meanings.sent1: The tabernacular decorations in the church were beautiful.
meanings.sent2: The tabernacular music filled the sacred space with joy.
meanings.sent3: The tabernacular candles flickered softly during the ceremony.
meanings.sent4: His voice echoed in the tabernacular hall, creating a solemn atmosphere.
meanings.sent5: The tabernacular altar was adorned with flowers for the special occasion.

meanings.definition: Characteristic of a tabernacle or sacred space.
meanings.sent1: The tabernacular aura of the temple inspired reverence.
meanings.sent2: The tabernacular symbols on the walls held deep meaning.
meanings.sent3: The tabernacular silence in the chapel soothed her troubled mind.
meanings.sent4: The tabernacular architecture of the mosque was breathtaking.
meanings.sent5: The tabernacular atmosphere of the shrine felt peaceful and serene.
